name: Muslim Advocates
mission: TO PROMOTE EQUALITY, LIBERTY AND JUSTICE FOR ALL, BY PROVIDING LEADERSHIP THROUGH LEGAL ADVOCACY, POLICY ENGAGEMENT AND CIVIC EDUCATION AND BY SERVING A...
theoryOfChange: Muslim Advocates' Annual Report outlines their strategic framework. It states their commitment to "leveraging our nationally recognized legal-advocacy skills to help Muslims and other historically marginalized groups enjoy the full spectrum of American civic life with dignity." They measure their impact against "three pillars: building community power, dismantling discriminatory systems, and demanding shared wellbeing." Their strategies include "High-impact, precedent-setting legal advocacy that reflects the demands of social movements and leads to systemic change," "Policy engagement at the federal, state, and local levels that hold policymakers accountable to the demands of the diverse, intersecting spectrum of Muslim communities," "Advocacy that builds power by providing analysis, training, and resources," and "Narrative-shifting communications work that disrupts the oppressive framing of Muslim identities." The report also details their mission and vision to "promote justice and equity while protecting the diverse spectrum of Muslim communities from anti-Muslim targeting in all of its forms."
zakatClaimEvidence: Gifts made to Muslim Advocates are Zakat-eligible, more information is available. (Source: https://muslimadvocates.org/donate/)

The organization reported total revenue of $992,892 and holds 7.8 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 65/100 score, reflecting a strong impact in capacity building and legal advocacy, though its overall rating is tempered by high fundraising expenses and a moderate program spending ratio.

program expense ratio of 54.9% is lower than industry benchmarks for direct service charities

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows moderate alignment with a focus on advocacy as a high-urgency cause, though it currently has a lower fit for traditional Muslim donors compared to direct-relief charities [1][8]. Its track record includes significant legal awards and civil rights accomplishments [5][7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact in the area of capacity building, focusing on long-term legal and policy shifts rather than direct cost-per-beneficiary services [1][3]. While it holds 7.8 months of working capital, only 54.9% of its $992,892 total revenue is directed toward program expenses [2][4].

baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Washington, D.C., Muslim Advocates works to protect the rights of American Muslims and other marginalized communities through legal representation and civic education [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $992,892 and is recognized as zakat-eligible for donors seeking to fulfill their religious obligations [2][8].

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="1">7.8 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term advocacy projects.
Muslim Advocates provides <cite id="1">legal representation and policy engagement</cite> specifically tailored to the needs of marginalized communities.
The charity is <cite id="8">recognized as zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing donors to support civil rights through religious giving.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Advocates demonstrates high organizational capacity through its governance and strategic focus. The organization maintains an <cite id="1">independent board of 10 members</cite>, ensuring robust oversight of its mission to promote equality and liberty. Their program model is built on <cite id="1">capacity building and legal advocacy</cite>, which is a high-leverage approach to social change. Furthermore, the organization has a long track record in the sector, having been <cite id="1">active for nearly 20 years</cite> since its founding in 2006, establishing itself as a fixture in the American Muslim civil rights landscape.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Advocates is a national civil rights organization that operates at the intersection of legal advocacy, policy engagement, and civic education to protect the rights of American Muslims. Based in Washington, D.C., the organization provides <cite id="1">specialized legal representation and policy advocacy</cite> aimed at promoting equality and justice. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $992,892</cite>, reflecting a significant shift in its financial scale compared to previous years. Despite a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of -62.5%</cite>, the charity maintains a resilient financial position with <cite id="1">7.8 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring it can sustain operations during periods of economic volatility. Their work includes high-impact litigation and the <cite id="8">Muslim Charities Accreditation Program (MCAP)</cite>, which helps strengthen the institutional integrity of the American Muslim nonprofit sector. The organization is <cite id="8">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, offering a strategic avenue for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through systemic advocacy and the protection of civil liberties.
